sentences.en: A supplementary volume has been published containing the index.
sentences.cn: 附有索引的增补卷已经出版.

sentences.en: He suffered a hairline fracture of the right index finger.
His index finger tightened on the trigger but then relaxed again.
sentences.cn: 他的食指扣住扳机,然后又松开了.

sentences.en: I riffled through the pages until I reached the index.
If the entry is listed under shading, the index fails the user.
sentences.cn: 如果该条目列在底纹中, 那么这个索引对于用户来说是失败的.

sentences.en: Look it up in the index.
Manner of walking gives an index to one's charactor.
sentences.cn: 走路的姿态可反应出人的性格.

sentences.en: The changing size of an infant’s head is considered an index of brain growth
sentences.cn: 婴儿头围不断变大标志着大脑在发育。

sentences.en: The FT 30 share index was up 16.4 points to 1,599.6.
sentences.cn: 《金融时报》30股指上涨16.4点，收于1,559.6点。

sentences.en: The increasing sale of luxury goods is an index for the country's prosperity.
sentences.cn: 奢侈商品销售量日增是该国繁荣的标志.

sentences.en: The index adds appreciably to the usefulness of the book.
sentences.cn: 索引明显地增加了这本书的实用价值.

sentences.en: The index of industrial production increased.
The index of the performance of leading shares recorded a 16 per cent fall.
sentences.cn: 龙头股指数录得16个百分点的跌幅。

sentences.en: The number of new houses being built is a good index of a country's prosperity.
sentences.cn: 新建房屋的数目是国家繁荣的一个有用指标。

sentences.en: The thumbtack pricked his index finger.
sentences.cn: 大头针扎了他一下手指.
皱纹显示出年岁在增加.

words.tran_cn: [图情] 标引；[数] 指标化；编制指数
指出（index的ing形式）；编入索引中

phrases.tran_cn: 身体质量指数；体质指数；体质指数
复合指标；财经综合指数
多样性指数；歧异度指数

trans.tran_en: an alphabetical list of names, subjects etc at the back of a book, with the numbers of the pages where they can be found
if documents, information etc are indexed, an index is made for them

trans.tran_cn: 给…编索引，把…编入索引，[经济学]按生活指数调整（工资、价格等）
trans.tran_en: if documents, information etc are indexed, an index is made for them
